intro: Chaerophyllum australianum, commonly known as the Australian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, shady areas such as forest floors and along stream banks.
